page.title: 09ST.NICHOLAS'S CHURCH.
page.content: WHEN WE WENT TO ST.NICHOLAS'S CHURCH ACROSS THE ROAD WE FOUND OUT IT WAS RESTORED IN 1703. SOME PARTS ARE THIRTEENTH CENTURY AND THE WINDOWS ARE FIFTEENTH CENTURY. WHEN WE WENT IN I SAW FRESCOES WHICH ARE PAINTINGS ON WALLS.ON ONE OF THE WALLS THERE WERE PLANKS OF WOOD AND ON THEM WAS WRITING.INSTEAD OF USING AN "S" IN THE WRITING THEY USED AN "F". THERE WAS A TOMB OF RICHARD POWLETT,THE COLOURS WERE FAINT. YEARS AGO THEY WOULD HAVE BEEN BRIGHTER THAN THEY ARE NOW. I HOPE MORE PEOPLE WILL USE THE CHURCH IN THE FUTURE. THERE WAS A VISITORS BOOK AND MRS.LETCHER SIGNED THE TEACHERS NAMES AND JASON SIGNED FROM LAVERSTOKE SCHOOL.
